events.name: Battery Technology Development
events.wd_description: Analysis of the risk assessment of cobalt and lithium, using MFA method in 2019.
events.description: Analysis of the risk assessment of cobalt and lithium, using MFA method in 2019.

events.name: Solid-State Batteries
events.wd_description: Development of solid-state batteries as a new advanced battery technology.
events.description: Development of solid-state batteries as a new advanced battery technology.

events.wd_description: Development of sodium-ion batteries as a new advanced battery technology.

events.name: Lithium-Ion Battery Recycling
events.wd_description: Methods for recycling lithium-ion batteries including pyrometallurgical, hydrometallurgical, bioleaching, and direct recycling.
events.description: Methods for recycling lithium-ion batteries including pyrometallurgical, hydrometallurgical, bioleaching, and direct recycling.

events.name: Pyrometallurgy
events.wd_description: Employs extreme heat to transform metal oxides into cobalt, copper, iron, and nickel alloys.
events.description: Employs extreme heat to transform metal oxides into cobalt, copper, iron, and nickel alloys.

events.name: Hydrometallurgy
events.wd_description: Uses aqueous solutions to leach targeted metals out from the cathode substance.
events.description: Uses aqueous solutions to leach targeted metals out from the cathode substance.

events.name: Bioleaching
events.wd_description: Uses bacteria to retrieve precious metals.
events.description: Uses bacteria to retrieve precious metals.

events.name: Future prospects of lithium-ion batteries
events.wd_description: Despite advancements in battery technology, lithium-ion batteries will remain the dominant technology until at least 2030. Lithium cannot be substituted, but cobalt use is expected to decrease.
events.description: Despite advancements in battery technology, lithium-ion batteries will remain the dominant technology until at least 2030. Lithium cannot be substituted, but cobalt use is expected to decrease.

events.name: Dominance of lithium-ion batteries
events.wd_description: Lithium-ion batteries will continue to be the prevalent technology in use during the next decade, with lithium as a crucial constituent.
events.description: Lithium-ion batteries will continue to be the prevalent technology in use during the next decade, with lithium as a crucial constituent.

events.name: Cobalt reduction in cathode materials
events.wd_description: The trend towards cathode materials with less or no cobalt is expected to grow, reducing dependency on cobalt.
events.description: The trend towards cathode materials with less or no cobalt is expected to grow, reducing dependency on cobalt.
